meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thin.
meanings.sent1: Her thinness made her look fragile.
meanings.sent2: The thinness of the paper made it easy to tear.
meanings.sent3: The thinness of the ice cream layer on the cake was comical.
meanings.sent4: The thinness of the thread holding the button seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent5: The thinness of the air at the mountain peak took his breath away.

meanings.definition: A lack of thickness or depth.
meanings.sent1: The thinness of the book made it a quick read.
meanings.sent2: He was concerned about the thinness of the ice on the lake.
meanings.sent3: The thinness of the plot in the movie was laughable.
meanings.sent4: The thinness of her excuse was transparent.
meanings.sent5: The thinness of the fog obscured the view ahead.

meanings.definition: A small amount or degree of something.
meanings.sent1: The thinness of the sauce made it perfect for dipping.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed by the thinness of the soup.
meanings.sent3: The thinness of his patience was evident in his short replies.
meanings.sent4: The thinness of the crowd at the event surprised him.
meanings.sent5: The thinness of the smile on her face hinted at her true feelings.
